_header: One it is and ne haveth nother
_description: The Covetous Man (translating a Latin prose sentence) — four couplets

BLHar7322.Transcription:
On hit is and ne haueþ noþerSone ne suster ne nouþer
                    broþerNe he nere blynneþ of trauaillingHe nis no child of
                    gud halewingfor one him self he ne þen kepfor wham he wakeþ
                    and harde swinkeþhe walkeþ boþe dai and niȝt&
                    leteþ his soule be vuel diȝt
BLHar7322.Note:
In line six, there is possibly an ‘o’ or sigma
                    ‘s’ partially overwritten by the ‘w’; thus
                    ‘wham’ might be instead ‘swain’?

Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
